description: A Fielder sequence: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-3) + a(n-4), n >= 4.
comments: For n > 1, a(n) is the number of ways of choosing a subset of vertices of an n-cycle so that every vertex of the n-cycle is adjacent to one of the chosen vertices. (Note that this is not the same as the number of dominating sets of the n-cycle, which is given by A001644.) [From _Joel B. Lewis_, Sep 12 2010]
references: Fielder, Daniel C.; Special integer sequences controlled by three parameters. Fibonacci Quart 6 1968 64-70.

formula: G.f.: (1-x)(4+x+x^2)/((1+x^2)(1-x-x^2)). a(n)=L(n)+i^n+(-i)^n, a(2n)=L(n)^2, a(2n+1)=L(2n+1) where L() is Lucas sequence.
